xxl.core.cursors.identities

Class ThreadedIterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.cursors.identities.ThreadedIterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterator

    public class ThreadedIterator
extends Object
implements Iterator
    This class provides a wrapper for iterations to let them run in a new thread. There are different motivations to use this class. If you have got a data source that delivers data infrequently you can put the iteration into a threaded iterator. The threaded iterator buffers the data such that the waiting time for subsequent processing will be reduced.

    Note: The class itself cannot be used by multiple threads simultaneously!

    See Also:
    Iterator, Thread

    • Field Detail

      • iterator

        protected Iterator iterator
        The iteration to be observed.

      • tsQueue

        protected Queue tsQueue
        A queue that is used for storing elements of this iterator.

      • initialized

        protected boolean initialized
        A boolean flag determining whether the internally used thread has initilized or not.

      • threads

        protected Thread[] threads
        An array of threads that is used to run the wrapped iterators.

      • numThreadsRunning

        protected int numThreadsRunning
        The number of threads that are sill running. This number indicates whether the threaded iterator will run out of elements soon.

      • waitForThreadChannel

        protected AsynchronousChannel waitForThreadChannel
        An asynchronous channel for communication between the threads and the threaded iterator. The name of the variable is chosen from the perspective of the threaded iterator.

      • signalThreadChannel

        protected AsynchronousChannel signalThreadChannel
        An asynchronous channel for communication between the threaded iterator and the threads. The name of the variable is chosen from the perspective of the threaded iterator.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThreadedIterator

        public ThreadedIterator(Iterator[] iterators,
                        Queue queue,
                        int threadPriority)
        Constructs a new thread iterator. The given iterators run in their own threads. The threads start working after the first demand (a call to hasNext or next).
        Parameters:
        iterators - an array of iterators that should run in single threads.
        queue - a queue that stores the delivered objects of the given iterators. In order to get a buffer of a fixed size use a bounded queue.
        threadPriority - the priority of the threads.

      • ThreadedIterator

        public ThreadedIterator(Iterator iterator)
        Constructs a new thread iterator wrapping a single iterator and using a list-queue for storing the elements of the wrapped iterator. The priority of the internally used thread is set to Thread.NORM_PRIORITY.
        Parameters:
        iterator - the iterator that should run in a thread.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected void init()
        Initializes the threaded iterator and starts the single threads.

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Returns true if the iteration has more elements. (In other words, returns true if next or peek would return an element rather than throwing an exception.)
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface Iterator
        Returns:
        true if the iteration has more elements.

      • next

        public Object next()
            throws NoSuchElementException
        Returns the next element in the iteration. This element will be accessible by the iteration's remove method, until a call to next occurs. This is calling next proceeds the iteration and therefore its previous element will not be accessible any more.
        Specified by:
        next in interface Iterator
        Returns:
        the next element in the iteration.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the iteration has no more elements.

      • remove

        public void remove()
            throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Removes from the underlying data structure the last element returned by the iteration (optional operation). This method can be called only once per call to next and removes the element returned by this method. Note, that between a call to next and remove the invocation of hasNext is forbidden. The behaviour of an iteration is unspecified if the underlying data structure is modified while the iteration is in progress in any way other than by calling this method.

        Note, that this operation is optional and might not work for all cursors.

        Specified by:
        remove in interface Iterator
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the remove operation is not supported by the iteration.
